I don't have to wait for the client to recognis the absence of the server. Restarting the server and refreshing the page in the browser is enough for me to reproduce this error.

I tried this in Firefox (2.0.0.8).
I have no Problems with FireFox 2.0.0.9, but the problem occurs at every refresh in Internet Explorer 6.0.2900.

The HTTP 500 should not appear anymore - the multiple client handling mechanism has changed, though. A Requests of an additional client to an already existing session leeds to an instant session restart. The existing state of the initial client is getting invalid and the user will be notified about this the next time he tries to use it by an confirmation box. This decision for this approach was made due to the possibility of future enhancements in the architecture: Instead of restarting the session an additional display instance could be created and both application instances could run in parallel.
